Interface AsyncRequestImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AsyncResponseProcessor<RESPONSE_TYPE>, java.lang.AutoCloseable, RequestImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE>

extends RequestImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE>, AsyncResponseProcessor<RESPONSE_TYPE>

      • setNoHungRequestCheck

        void setNoHungRequestCheck()
        Disable check for hung request. This must be called when a response must wait for a subsequent request.

      • getPendingResponseCount

        int getPendingResponseCount()
        Returns a count of the number of subordinate requests which have not yet responded.
        Returns:
        A count of the number of subordinate requests which have not yet responded.

      • processAsyncException

        void processAsyncException(java.lang.Exception _response)
        Returns an exception as a response instead of throwing it. But regardless of how a response is returned, if the response is an exception it is passed to the exception handler of the request that did the call or send on the request.
        Parameters:
        _response - An exception.

      • setExceptionHandler

        ExceptionHandler<RESPONSE_TYPE> setExceptionHandler(ExceptionHandler<RESPONSE_TYPE> _exceptionHandler)
        Replace the current ExceptionHandler with another.

        When an event or request message is processed by a targetReactor, the current exception handler is set to null. When a request is sent by a targetReactor, the current exception handler is saved in the outgoing message and restored when the response message is processed.

        Parameters:
        _exceptionHandler - The exception handler to be used now. May be null if the default exception handler is to be used.
        Returns:
        The exception handler that was previously in effect, or null if the default exception handler was in effect.

      • send

        <RT> void send(RequestImpl<RT> _requestImpl,
             AsyncResponseProcessor<RT> _responseProcessor)
        Send a subordinate request, providing the originating request is not canceled.
        Type Parameters:
        RT - The type of result value.
        Parameters:
        _requestImpl - The subordinate request.
        _responseProcessor - A callback to handle the result value from the subordinate request.

      • send

        <RT,RT2> void send(RequestImpl<RT> _requestImpl,
                 AsyncResponseProcessor<RT2> _dis,
                 RT2 _fixedResponse)
        Send a subordinate request, providing the originating request is not canceled.
        Type Parameters:
        RT - The response value type of the subordinate request.
        RT2 - The fixed response type.
        Parameters:
        _requestImpl - The subordinate request.
        _dis - The callback to handle a fixed response when the result of the subordinate request is received.
        _fixedResponse - The fixed response to be used.

      • send

        <RT> RequestImpl<RT> send(SOp<RT> _sOp,
                        AsyncResponseProcessor<RT> _asyncResponseProcessor)
        Pass a request to its target reactor, providing the originating request is not canceled.
        Type Parameters:
        RT - The type of response returned.
        Parameters:
        _sOp - A synchronous operation, optionally used to define a SyncRequest.
        _asyncResponseProcessor - Handles the response.

      • send

        <RT,RT2> RequestImpl<RT> send(SOp<RT> _sOp,
                            AsyncResponseProcessor<RT2> _dis,
                            RT2 _fixedResponse)
        Pass a request to its target and then replace its response value, providing the originating request is not canceled. Useful when you do not care about the actual response being passed back.
        Type Parameters:
        RT - The response value type.
        RT2 - The replacement value type.
        Parameters:
        _sOp - A synchronous operation, optionally used to define a SyncRequest.
        _dis - The callback to be invoked when a response value is received.
        _fixedResponse - The replacement value.

      • send

                             AsyncResponseProcessor<RT> _asyncResponseProcessor)
        Pass a request to its target reactor, providing the originating request is not canceled.
        Type Parameters:
        RT - The type of response returned.
        Parameters:
        _aOp - An asynchronous operation, optionally used to define an AsyncRequest.
        _asyncResponseProcessor - Handles the response.

                                 AsyncResponseProcessor<RT2> _dis,
                                 RT2 _fixedResponse)
        Pass a request to its target and then replace its response value, providing the originating request is not canceled. Useful when you do not care about the actual response being passed back.
        Type Parameters:
        RT - The response value type.
        RT2 - The replacement value type.
        Parameters:

        _dis - The callback to be invoked when a response value is received.
        _fixedResponse - The replacement value.

        Do a direct method call on an AReq.

      • onCancel

        void onCancel(AsyncRequestImpl _asyncRequestImpl)
        An optional callback used to signal that the request has been canceled. This method must be thread-safe, as there is no constraint on which thread is used to call it. The default action of onCancel is to call cancelAll and, if the reactor is not a common reactor, sends a response of null via a bound response processor.

      • onClose

        void onClose(AsyncRequestImpl _asyncRequestImpl)
        An optional callback used to signal that the request has been closed. This method must be thread-safe, as there is no constraint on which thread is used to call it. By default, onClose does nothing.
